text: (upbeat music)
- [Narrator] When you migrate on premises

Oracle databases to
PostgreSQL on the AWS cloud,

you also need to update the
SQL code in your applications.
This updated SQL code interacts
with the new PostgreSQL database,
instead of the old Oracle database.
AWS Schema Conversion Tool

automates conversion of
database schemas in objects,

as well as the SQL code
in your applications.
For an Oracle to post your SQL conversion,

AWS SCT dives deep into
the application logic
and extracts SQL statements
from different application objects.

Then AWS SCT converts
these SQL statements,

and inserts them back into
your application code.
(upbeat music)

For C#, Java, and Pro*C
applications, AWS SCT

uses language-specific
application SQL code converters.
This video demonstrates how to use AWS SCT
to convert SQL code in C# applications.
(upbeat music)
For this demonstration video,
we created a new AWS SCT project,

and connected to our
source Oracle database.
We also added a new mapping rule,
which establishes a source target pair.

This pair includes the source
Chinook database schema
and a virtual PostgreSQL target.
(upbeat music)
After we converted this database schema,

we add C# application code
to the AWS SCT project.

We enter a name of the C#
application conversion project

and the location of the
source application code.

This application uses the
Chinook database schema.

Because we established a
mapping rule for this schema,
AWS SCT highlights it in bold.

We choose this schema to
add the C# application code
to the AWS SCT project.

AWS SCT displays the
source application code

under the C# node in the
source metadata tree.
(upbeat music)
Now we convert the SQL statements
embedded in the source application code.
AWS SCT analyzes the source code

and collects statements from
different application objects,

such as functions, parameters,
local variables, and so on.
We switch to the assessment report view
to review the conversion summary.
Several SQL code statements
require manual conversion actions.

You can save the extracted SQL
statements to adjacent file.
(upbeat music)
For the string builder append source file,
AWS SCT extracted this SQL query.
This query consists of two parts,

which were located in
different code objects.

In AWS SCT, we switch
to the action items tab
and review the conversion action items.
(upbeat music)
You can see the code

of the string builder append
source file in the left panel.

AWS SCT converts the SQL code,
inserts it in the C# file,

and displays the result
in the right panel.
(upbeat music)
AWS SCT creates a node

with your updated
application source code files
in the target metadata tree.
Now you can save your application code
and build a new application

to interact with your
new PostgreSQL database.
(upbeat music)

After you save the
application code to files,
you can review them.
In the string builder append file,

you can see the converted
SQL statement here.

You can review and edit your
source application code here,

and then add it to your
application project.

This completes the overview
of SQL code conversion

in C# applications for Oracle
to PostgreSQL migrations.
Thanks for watching this video.
